Can't repro on 50422 or 50426. Is it intermittent? Please provide more info 
about how to reproduce. 
Is this a clean workspace? 
Is the specified tomcat the version that actually is installed?
Steps to reproduce starting from a clean workspace?

I think the trick is to create the Web Module from the J2EE perspective:

Right click on your already existing FlexibleProject and select New -> J2EE Web
Module. Choose a module name, click on Finish, and here you go...

Can you reproduce it? If not, I will provide a step-by-step instruction.

I am using Tomcat 5.5.9 (it is actually installed at the configured location)
and my Flexible Project is created with all settings to defaults.

I was able to reproduce this exception once but can't reproduce it again. Can 
you send detailed steps to reproduce from a new workspace? Please specify what 
perspective you are in in each step and where you select the menu options (ie. 
right click on a file to bring up the context menu, select file from the main 
menu).

I am not able to reproduce this problem by right clicking on a flexible 
project. I am able to reproduce this error consistently by right clicking on 
Dynamic Web Projects and selecting New->J2EE Web Module.

As the error does not occur when the flexible project is selected, this 
problem can be avoided by ensuring that a flexible project is selected when 
you create a new J2EE Web Module. I suggest we lower the severity of this 
defect.

Based on Lawrence's investigation, and the intermittant nature of this bug, 
I'm changing this severity to major, and increasing its priority to P2 to
indicate it needs fixed quickly in M5 cycle. 

Andreas, if you know of severe consequences, such as data loss, or something,
that  we haven't seen, plesae clarify.

Andreas, I just tested this on the I20050428 driver and am not able to 
reproduce the problem following the scenario I used on I20050422. Please 
verify that this is no longer a problem on I20050428.

It still happens on I20050428 (the 19:28 build). I have just copied over the
contents of the zip on the I20050422 installation. Since no dependancies have
changed, this should work, right?

steps from a clean workspace:

- close welcome screen

- add j2ee perspective (and stay there for all steps)

- install tomcat runtime environment: preferences -> installed runtimes ->
add... -> expand Apache -> Apache Tomcat v5.5 -> Next -> complete installation
directory (at my place its C:\dev\jakarta-tomcat-5.5.9) -> Finish -> check
tomcat as default -> OK

- create flexible project: file -> new -> expand Java -> Flexible Java Project
-> Next -> complete name ("flexibleProject") -> Finish

- expand "Other Projects" (the newly created flexible project should appear there)

- create web module: right click on newly created project ("flexibleProject") ->
new -> j2ee web module -> complete name ("webModule") -> here you go, exception

I have just discovered that after the exception, the flexible project has been
moved over to "Dynamic Web Projects". If I expand the node, another exception
occurs and one node of the tree view is empty (I will upload a screenshot).
